recap_documents.description: OPINION AND ORDER - Merrill Lynch's and Tilney's motions to dismiss the holding claims are GRANTED.  Thus all claims brought by Farm Family Life Insurance Company, Farm Family Casualty Insurance and National Western Life Insurance are there fore DISMISSED.  Tilney's motion to dismiss plaintiffs' unspecified Texas Securities Act claims as time-barred is DENIED.  Provided that more specificity about Enron's misrepresentations is submitted, the Texas Securities Act claims ma y go forward.  The remaining portions of the motions to dismiss are currently DENIED to allow plaintiffs an opportunity to cure the pleading deficiencies.  Plaintiffs are GRANTED leave to supplement their First Amended Complaint, but should defer doi ng so until the Court resolves Merrill Lynch's pending motion for partial summary judgment, which the Court is currently reviewing.  When it issues its decision of ht emotion for partial summary judgment, it will establish a new pleading schedul e.  Motions terminated:  48  MOTION to Dismiss (Partial) Plaintiffs' First Amended Complaint (Dkt # 46) MOTION to Dismiss (Partial) Plaintiffs' First Amended Complaint (Dkt # 46),  47  MOTION to Dismiss Plaintiffs' First Amended Complaint.( Signed by Judge Melinda Harmon ) Parties notified.(htippen, )

recap_documents.description: ORDER denying 363 Motion for Acquittal as to Martin Shkreli. For the reasons set forth in the attached Memorandum and Order, the court respectfully denies defendant's motion for a judgment of acquittal 363 . For the purposes of sentencing, the court will apply a loss amount of $2,998,000 on Count Three, $3,402,450 on Count Six, and $4,000,000 on Count Eight. Ordered by Judge Kiyo A. Matsumoto on 2/26/2018. (Tata, Vivek) (Entered: 02/26/2018)
